meanings.definition: a person who delivers a lecture or speech
meanings.sent1: The prelectors at the conference captivated the audience with their informative speeches.
meanings.sent2: The university invited renowned prelectors to share their knowledge with the students.
meanings.sent3: The prelectors at the comedy club had the audience laughing uncontrollably with their hilarious lectures.
meanings.sent4: The prelectors of wisdom sprinkled their knowledge like seeds, nurturing the minds of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The prelectors stood tall on the stage, their words echoing in the hall.

meanings.definition: to deliver a lecture or speech
meanings.sent1: She prelectors confidently in front of the class, sharing her research findings.
meanings.sent2: The professor prelectors every Monday morning on the history of art.
meanings.sent3: The parrot prelectors to anyone who passes by, amusing the neighborhood with its mimicry.
meanings.sent4: The river prelectors to the rocks, shaping them over time with its constant flow.
meanings.sent5: The wind prelectors through the trees, whispering secrets to the leaves.
